intro: Gonzalea coccocypselum, commonly known as the red-flowered gonzalea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers, which bloom in dense clusters during the spring and summer seasons. Its leaves are typically alternate, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy texture. Gonzalea coccocypselum thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain.
